00001 // CLASSIFICATION: UNCLASSIFIED
00002 
00003 /***************************************************************************/
00004 /* RSC IDENTIFIER:  Geoid Library
00005  *
00006  * ABSTRACT
00007  *
00008  *    The purpose of GEOID is to support conversions between WGS84 ellipsoid
00009  *    heights and WGS84 geoid heights.
00010  *
00011  *
00012  * ERROR HANDLING
00013  *
00014  *    This component checks parameters for valid values.  If an invalid value
00015  *    is found, the error code is combined with the current error code using
00016  *    the bitwise or.  This combining allows multiple error codes to be
00017  *    returned. The possible error codes are:
00018  *
00019  *  GEOID_NO_ERROR               : No errors occured in function
00020  *  GEOID_FILE_OPEN_ERROR        : Geoid file opening error
00021  *  GEOID_INITIALIZE_ERROR       : Geoid seoaration database can not initialize
00022  *  GEOID_LAT_ERROR              : Latitude out of valid range
00023  *                                 (-90 to 90 degrees)
00024  *  GEOID_LON_ERROR              : Longitude out of valid range
00025  *                                 (-180 to 360 degrees)
00026  *
00027  * REUSE NOTES
00028  *
00029  *    Geoid is intended for reuse by any application that requires conversion
00030  *    between WGS84 ellipsoid heights and WGS84 geoid heights.
00031  *
00032  * REFERENCES
00033  *
00034  *    Further information on Geoid can be found in the Reuse Manual.
00035  *
00036  *    Geoid originated from :  U.S. Army Topographic Engineering Center
00037  *                             Geospatial Information Division
00038  *                             7701 Telegraph Road
00039  *                             Alexandria, VA  22310-3864
00040  *
00041  * LICENSES
00042  *
00043  *    None apply to this component.
00044  *
00045  * RESTRICTIONS
00046  *
00047  *    Geoid has no restrictions.
00048  *
00049  * ENVIRONMENT
00050  *
00051  *    Geoid was tested and certified in the following environments
00052  *
00053  *    1. Solaris 2.5 with GCC 2.8.1
00054  *    2. MS Windows XP with MS Visual C++ 6.0
00055  *
00056  *
00057  * MODIFICATIONS
00058  *
00059  *    Date              Description
00060  *    ----              -----------
00061  *    24-May-99         Original Code
00062  *    09-Jan-06         Added new geoid height interpolation methods
00063  *    03-14-07          Original C++ Code
00064  *
00065  */
00066 
00067 
00068 /***************************************************************************/
00069 /*
00070  *                               INCLUDES
00071  */

00085  *    GeoidLibrary.h  - prototype error checking and error codes
00086  *    threads.h  - used for thread safety
00087  *    CoordinateConversionException.h - Exception handler
00088  *    ErrorMessages.h  - Contains exception messages
00089  */

00100 const double PI = 3.14159265358979323e0; /* PI */
00101 const double PI_OVER_2 = PI / 2.0;
00102 const double TWO_PI = 2.0 * PI;
00103 const double _180_OVER_PI = (180.0 / PI);
00104 const int EGM96_COLS = 1441;                   /* 360 degrees of longitude at 15 minute spacing */
00105 const int EGM96_ROWS = 721;                    /* 180 degrees of latitude  at 15 minute spacing */
00106 const int EGM84_COLS = 37;                     /* 360 degrees of longitude at 10 degree spacing */
00107 const int EGM84_ROWS = 19;                     /* 180 degrees of latitude  at 10 degree spacing */
00108 const int EGM96_HEADER_ITEMS = 6;              /* min, max lat, min, max long, lat, long spacing*/
00109 const double SCALE_FACTOR_15_MINUTES = .25;    /* 4 grid cells per degree at 15 minute spacing  */
00110 const double SCALE_FACTOR_10_DEGREES = 10;     /* 1 / 10.0 grid cells per degree at 10 degree spacing */
00111 const double SCALE_FACTOR_30_MINUTES = .5;     /* 2 grid cells per degree at 30 minute spacing */
00112 const double SCALE_FACTOR_1_DEGREE = 1;        /* 1 grid cell per degree at 1 degree spacing */
00113 const double SCALE_FACTOR_2_DEGREES = 2;       /* 1 / 2 grid cells per degree at 2 degree spacing */
00114 const int EGM96_ELEVATIONS = EGM96_COLS * EGM96_ROWS;
00115 const int EGM84_ELEVATIONS = EGM84_COLS * EGM84_ROWS;
00116 const int EGM96_INSET_AREAS = 53;
00117 
00118 
00119 /* defines the egm96 variable grid */
00120 struct EGM96_Variable_Grid
00121 {
00122   double min_lat;        /* Min cell latitude */
00123   double max_lat;        /* Max cell latitude */
00124   double min_lon;        /* Min cell longitude */
00125   double max_lon;        /* Max cell latitude */
00126 }; 
00127

00188  */
00189 
00190 float readFloat( int *numRead, FILE* file )
00191 /*
00192  * The private function readFloat returns the geoid height
00193  * read from the geoid file. 4 bytes are read from the file and,
00194  * if necessary, the bytes are swapped.
00195  *
00196  *    numRead   : Number of heights read from file         (output)
00197  *
00198  */
00199 {
00200   float result;
00201   char* swap = ( char* )&result;
00202   char temp;
00203 
00204   *numRead = fread( swap, 4, 1, file );
00205 #ifdef LITTLE_ENDIAN
00206   temp = swap[0];
00207   swap[0] = swap[3];
00208   swap[3] = temp;
00209   temp = swap[1];
00210   swap[1] = swap[2];
00211   swap[2] = temp;
00212 #endif
00213 
00214   return result;
00215 }

00223 /* This class is a safeguard to make sure the singleton gets deleted
00224  * when the application exits
00225  */
00226 class MSP::CCS::GeoidLibraryCleaner
00227 {
00228   public:
00229 
00230   ~GeoidLibraryCleaner()
00231   {
00232     GeoidLibrary::deleteInstance();
00233   }
00234 
00235 } geoidLibraryCleanerInstance;

00237 
00238 // Make this class a singleton, so the data files are only initialized once
00239 GeoidLibrary* GeoidLibrary::instance = 0;
00240 int GeoidLibrary::instanceCount = 0;
00241 
00242 
00243 GeoidLibrary* GeoidLibrary::getInstance()
00244 {
00245   if( instance == 0 )
00246     instance = new GeoidLibrary;
00247 
00248   instanceCount++;
00249 
00250   return instance;
00251 }
00252 
00253 
00254 void GeoidLibrary::removeInstance()
00255 {
00256 /*
00257  * The function removeInstance removes this GeoidLibrary instance from the
00258  * total number of instances. 
00259  */
00260   if( --instanceCount < 1 )
00261   {
00262     deleteInstance();
00263   }
00264 }
00265 
00266 
00267 void GeoidLibrary::deleteInstance()
00268 {
00269 /*
00270  * Delete the singleton.
00271  */
00272 
00273   if( instance != 0 )
00274   {
00275     delete instance;
00276     instance = 0;
00277   }
00278 }

00280 
00281 GeoidLibrary::GeoidLibrary()
00282 {
00283 /*
00284  * The constructor creates an empty list which is used to store the geoid separation data
00285  * contained in the data files egm84.grd and egm96.grd
00286  */
00287 
00288   egm96GeoidList.reserve( EGM96_ELEVATIONS );
00289   egm84GeoidList.reserve( EGM84_ELEVATIONS );
00290 
00291   loadGeoids();
00292 }
00293 
00294 
00295 GeoidLibrary::GeoidLibrary( const GeoidLibrary &gl )
00296 {
00297   egm96GeoidList = gl.egm96GeoidList;
00298   egm84GeoidList = gl.egm84GeoidList;
00299 }
00300 
00301 
00302 GeoidLibrary::~GeoidLibrary()
00303 {
00304   egm96GeoidList.clear();
00305   egm84GeoidList.clear();
00306 }
00307 
00308 
00309 GeoidLibrary& GeoidLibrary::operator=( const GeoidLibrary &gl )
00310 {
00311   if ( &gl == this )
00312           return *this;
00313 
00314   egm96GeoidList = gl.egm96GeoidList;
00315   egm84GeoidList = gl.egm84GeoidList;
00316 
00317   return *this;
00318 }

00320 
00321 void GeoidLibrary::loadGeoids()
00322 {
00323 /*
00324  * The function loadGeoids reads geoid separation data from a file in
00325  * the current directory and builds the geoid separation table from it.
00326  * If the separation file can not be found or accessed, an error code of
00327  * GEOID_FILE_OPEN_ERROR is returned, If the separation file is incomplete
00328  * or improperly formatted, an error code of GEOID_INITIALIZE_ERROR is returned,
00329  * otherwise GEOID_NO_ERROR is returned. This function must be called before 
00330  * any of the other functions in this component.
00331  */
00332 
00333     initializeEGM96Geoid();
00334 
00335     initializeEGM84Geoid();
00336 }
00337 
00338 
00339 void GeoidLibrary::convertEllipsoidToEGM96FifteenMinBilinearGeoidHeight( double longitude, double latitude,  double ellipsoidHeight, double *geoidHeight )
00340 {
00341 /*
00342  * The function convertEllipsoidToEGM96FifteenMinBilinearGeoidHeight converts the specified WGS84
00343  * ellipsoid height at the specified geodetic coordinates to the equivalent
00344  * geoid height, using the EGM96 gravity model and the bilinear interpolation method.
00345  *
00346  *    longitude          : Geodetic longitude in radians          (input)
00347  *    latitude           : Geodetic latitude in radians           (input)
00348  *    ellipsoidHeight    : Ellipsoid height, in meters            (input)
00349  *    geoidHeight        : Geoid height, in meters.               (output)
00350  *
00351  */
00352 
00353   double  delta_height;
00354 
00355   bilinearInterpolate( longitude, latitude, SCALE_FACTOR_15_MINUTES, EGM96_COLS, EGM96_ROWS, egm96GeoidList, &delta_height );
00356   *geoidHeight = ellipsoidHeight - delta_height;
00357 }
00358 
00359 
00360 void GeoidLibrary::convertEllipsoidToEGM96VariableNaturalSplineHeight( double longitude, double latitude, double ellipsoidHeight, double *geoidHeight )
00361 {
00362 /*
00363  * The function convertEllipsoidToEGM96VariableNaturalSplineHeight converts the specified WGS84
00364  * ellipsoid height at the specified geodetic coordinates to the equivalent
00365  * geoid height, using the EGM96 gravity model and the natural spline interpolation method..
00366  *
00367  *    longitude          : Geodetic longitude in radians          (input)
00368  *    latitude           : Geodetic latitude in radians           (input)
00369  *    ellipsoidHeight    : Ellipsoid height, in meters            (input)
00370  *    geoidHeight        : Geoid height, in meters.               (output)
00371  *
00372  */
00373 
00374   int i = 0;
00375   int num_cols = EGM96_COLS;
00376   int num_rows = EGM96_ROWS;
00377   double latitude_degrees = latitude * _180_OVER_PI;
00378   double longitude_degrees = longitude * _180_OVER_PI;
00379   double scale_factor = SCALE_FACTOR_15_MINUTES;
00380   double delta_height;
00381   long found = 0;
00382 
00383   if( longitude_degrees < 0.0 )
00384     longitude_degrees += 360.0;
00385 
00386   while( !found && i < EGM96_INSET_AREAS )
00387   {
00388     if( ( latitude_degrees >= EGM96_Variable_Grid_Table[i].min_lat ) && ( longitude_degrees >= EGM96_Variable_Grid_Table[i].min_lon ) &&
00389         ( latitude_degrees < EGM96_Variable_Grid_Table[i].max_lat ) && ( longitude_degrees < EGM96_Variable_Grid_Table[i].max_lon ) )
00390     {
00391       scale_factor = SCALE_FACTOR_30_MINUTES; // use 30 minute by 30 minute grid
00392       num_cols = 721;
00393       num_rows = 361;
00394       found = 1;
00395     }
00396 
00397     i++;
00398   }
00399 
00400   if( !found )
00401   {
00402     if( latitude_degrees >= -60.0 && latitude_degrees < 60.0 )
00403     {
00404       scale_factor = SCALE_FACTOR_1_DEGREE; // use 1 degree by 1 degree grid
00405       num_cols = 361;
00406       num_rows = 181;
00407     }
00408     else
00409     {
00410       scale_factor = SCALE_FACTOR_2_DEGREES; // use 2 degree by 2 degree grid
00411       num_cols = 181;
00412       num_rows = 91;
00413     }
00414   }
00415 
00416   naturalSplineInterpolate( longitude, latitude, scale_factor, num_cols, num_rows, EGM96_ELEVATIONS-1, egm96GeoidList, &delta_height );
00417   *geoidHeight = ellipsoidHeight - delta_height;
00418 }
00419

00421 void GeoidLibrary::convertEllipsoidToEGM84TenDegBilinearHeight( double longitude, double latitude, double ellipsoidHeight, double *geoidHeight )
00422 {
00423 /*
00424  * The function convertEllipsoidToEGM84TenDegBilinearHeight converts the specified WGS84

00431  *    geoidHeight        : Geoid height, in meters.               (output)
00432  *
00433  */
00434 
00435   double delta_height;
00436 
00437   bilinearInterpolate( longitude, latitude, SCALE_FACTOR_10_DEGREES, EGM84_COLS, EGM84_ROWS, egm84GeoidList, &delta_height );
00438   *geoidHeight = ellipsoidHeight - delta_height;
00439 }

00463 void GeoidLibrary::convertEGM96FifteenMinBilinearGeoidToEllipsoidHeight( double longitude, double latitude, double geoidHeight,  double *ellipsoidHeight )
00464 {
00465 /*
00466  * The function convertEGM96FifteenMinBilinearGeoidToEllipsoidHeight converts the specified WGS84
00467  * geoid height at the specified geodetic coordinates to the equivalent
00468  * ellipsoid height, using the EGM96 gravity model and the bilinear interpolation method.
00469  *
00470  *    longitude           : Geodetic longitude in radians          (input)
00471  *    latitude            : Geodetic latitude in radians           (input)
00472  *    geoidHeight         : Geoid height, in meters.               (input)
00473  *    ellipsoidHeight     : Ellipsoid height, in meters            (output)
00474  *
00475  */
00476 
00477   double  delta_height;
00478 
00479   bilinearInterpolate( longitude, latitude, SCALE_FACTOR_15_MINUTES, EGM96_COLS, EGM96_ROWS, egm96GeoidList, &delta_height );
00480   *ellipsoidHeight = geoidHeight + delta_height;
00481 }

00484 void GeoidLibrary::convertEGM96VariableNaturalSplineToEllipsoidHeight( double longitude, double latitude, double geoidHeight, double *ellipsoidHeight )
00485 {
00486 /*
00487  * The function convertEGM96VariableNaturalSplineToEllipsoidHeight converts the specified WGS84
00488  * geoid height at the specified geodetic coordinates to the equivalent
00489  * ellipsoid height, using the EGM96 gravity model and the natural spline interpolation method.
00490  *
00491  *    longitude           : Geodetic longitude in radians          (input)
00492  *    latitude            : Geodetic latitude in radians           (input)
00493  *    geoidHeight         : Geoid height, in meters.               (input)
00494  *    ellipsoidHeight     : Ellipsoid height, in meters            (output)
00495  *
00496  */
00497 
00498   int i = 0;
00499   int num_cols = EGM96_COLS;
00500   int num_rows = EGM96_ROWS;
00501   double latitude_degrees = latitude * _180_OVER_PI;
00502   double longitude_degrees = longitude * _180_OVER_PI;
00503   double scale_factor = SCALE_FACTOR_15_MINUTES;
00504   double delta_height;
00505   long found = 0;
00506 
00507   if( longitude_degrees < 0.0 )
00508     longitude_degrees += 360.0;
00509 
00510   while( !found && i < EGM96_INSET_AREAS )
00511   {
00512     if( ( latitude_degrees >= EGM96_Variable_Grid_Table[i].min_lat ) && ( longitude_degrees >= EGM96_Variable_Grid_Table[i].min_lon ) &&
00513         ( latitude_degrees < EGM96_Variable_Grid_Table[i].max_lat ) && ( longitude_degrees < EGM96_Variable_Grid_Table[i].max_lon ) )
00514     {
00515       scale_factor = SCALE_FACTOR_30_MINUTES; // use 30 minute by 30 minute grid
00516       num_cols = 721;
00517       num_rows = 361;
00518       found = 1;
00519     }
00520 
00521     i++;
00522   }
00523 
00524   if( !found )
00525   {
00526     if( latitude_degrees >= -60.0 && latitude_degrees < 60.0 )
00527     {
00528       scale_factor = SCALE_FACTOR_1_DEGREE; // use 1 degree by 1 degree grid
00529       num_cols = 361;
00530       num_rows = 181;
00531     }
00532     else
00533     {
00534       scale_factor = SCALE_FACTOR_2_DEGREES; // use 2 degree by 2 degree grid
00535       num_cols = 181;
00536       num_rows = 91;
00537     }
00538   }
00539 
00540   naturalSplineInterpolate( longitude, latitude, scale_factor, num_cols, num_rows, EGM96_ELEVATIONS-1, egm96GeoidList, &delta_height );
00541   *ellipsoidHeight = geoidHeight + delta_height;
00542 }

00565 
00566 void GeoidLibrary::convertEGM84TenDegNaturalSplineToEllipsoidHeight( double longitude, double latitude, double geoidHeight, double *ellipsoidHeight )
00567 {
00568 /*
00569  * The function convertEGM84TenDegNaturalSplineToEllipsoidHeight converts the specified WGS84
00570  * geoid height at the specified geodetic coordinates to the equivalent
00571  * ellipsoid height, using the EGM84 gravity model and the natural spline interpolation method.
00572  *
00573  *    longitude           : Geodetic longitude in radians          (input)
00574  *    latitude            : Geodetic latitude in radians           (input)
00575  *    geoidHeight         : Geoid height, in meters.               (input)
00576  *    ellipsoidHeight     : Ellipsoid height, in meters            (output)
00577  *
00578  */
00579 
00580   double  delta_height;
00581 
00582   naturalSplineInterpolate( longitude, latitude, SCALE_FACTOR_10_DEGREES, EGM84_COLS, EGM84_ROWS, EGM84_ELEVATIONS-1, egm84GeoidList, &delta_height );
00583   *ellipsoidHeight = geoidHeight + delta_height;
00584 }
00585 
00586 
00587 /************************************************************************/
00588 /*                              PRIVATE FUNCTIONS     
00589  *
00590  */
00591 
00592 void GeoidLibrary::initializeEGM96Geoid()
00593 {
00594 /*
00595  * The function initializeEGM96Geoid reads geoid separation data from the egm96.grd
00596  *  file in the current directory and builds a geoid separation table from it.
00597  * If the separation file can not be found or accessed, an error code of
00598  * GEOID_FILE_OPEN_ERROR is returned, If the separation file is incomplete
00599  * or improperly formatted, an error code of GEOID_INITIALIZE_ERROR is returned,
00600  * otherwise GEOID_NO_ERROR is returned.
00601  */
00602 
00603   int items_read = 0;
00604   char* file_name = 0;
00605   char* path_name = getenv( "MSPCCS_DATA" );
00606   long elevations_read = 0;
00607   long items_discarded = 0;
00608   long num = 0;
00609   FILE*  geoid_height_file;
00610 
00611   Thread_Mutex geoid_96_mutex;
00612   long mutex_error = Threads_Create_Mutex( &geoid_96_mutex );
00613   if( !mutex_error )
00614     mutex_error = Threads_Lock_Mutex( geoid_96_mutex );
00615 
00616 /*  Check the environment for a user provided path, else current directory;   */
00617 /*  Build a File Name, including specified or default path:                   */
00618 
00619   if (path_name != NULL)
00620   {
00621     file_name = new char[ strlen( path_name ) + 11 ];
00622     strcpy( file_name, path_name );
00623     strcat( file_name, "/" );
00624   }
00625   else
00626   {
00627     file_name = new char[ 18 ];
00628     strcpy( file_name, "../../data/" );
00629   }
00630   strcat( file_name, "egm96.grd" );
00631 
00632 /*  Open the File READONLY, or Return Error Condition:                        */
00633 
00634   if ( ( geoid_height_file = fopen( file_name, "rb" ) ) == NULL )
00635   {
00636     delete [] file_name;
00637     file_name = 0;
00638 
00639     if( !mutex_error )
00640       mutex_error = Threads_Unlock_Mutex( geoid_96_mutex );
00641     if( !mutex_error )
00642       Threads_Destroy_Mutex( geoid_96_mutex );
00643 
00644     char message[256] = "";
00645     strcpy( message, ErrorMessages::geoidFileOpenError );
00646     strcat( message, ": egm96.grd\n" );
00647     throw CoordinateConversionException( message );
00648   }
00649 
00650 /*  Skip the Header Line:                                                     */
00651 
00652   while ( num < EGM96_HEADER_ITEMS )
00653   {
00654     if ( feof( geoid_height_file ) ) break;
00655     if ( ferror( geoid_height_file ) ) break;
00656     egm96GeoidList.push_back( readFloat( &items_read, geoid_height_file ) );
00657     items_discarded += items_read;
00658     num++;
00659   }
00660 
00661 /*  Determine if header read properly, or NOT:                                */
00662 
00663   if( egm96GeoidList[0] !=  -90.0 ||
00664       egm96GeoidList[1] !=   90.0 ||
00665       egm96GeoidList[2] !=    0.0 ||
00666       egm96GeoidList[3] !=  360.0 ||
00667       egm96GeoidList[4] !=  SCALE_FACTOR_15_MINUTES ||
00668       egm96GeoidList[5] !=  SCALE_FACTOR_15_MINUTES ||
00669       items_discarded != EGM96_HEADER_ITEMS )
00670   {
00671     fclose( geoid_height_file );
00672     delete [] file_name;
00673     file_name = 0;
00674 
00675     if( !mutex_error )
00676       mutex_error = Threads_Unlock_Mutex( geoid_96_mutex );
00677     if( !mutex_error )
00678       Threads_Destroy_Mutex( geoid_96_mutex );
00679 
00680     char message[256] = "";
00681     strcpy( message, ErrorMessages::geoidFileParseError );
00682     strcat( message, ": egm96.grd\n" );
00683     throw CoordinateConversionException( message );
00684   }
00685 
00686 /*  Extract elements from the file:                                           */
00687   egm96GeoidList.clear();
00688 
00689   num = 0;
00690   while ( num < EGM96_ELEVATIONS )
00691   {
00692     if ( feof( geoid_height_file ) ) break;
00693     if ( ferror( geoid_height_file ) ) break;
00694     egm96GeoidList.push_back( readFloat ( &items_read, geoid_height_file ) );
00695     elevations_read += items_read;
00696     num++;
00697   }
00698 
00699 /*  Determine if all elevations of file read properly, or NOT:                */
00700 
00701   if ( elevations_read != EGM96_ELEVATIONS )
00702   {
00703     fclose(geoid_height_file);
00704     delete [] file_name;
00705     file_name = 0;
00706 
00707     if( !mutex_error )
00708       mutex_error = Threads_Unlock_Mutex( geoid_96_mutex );
00709     if( !mutex_error )
00710       Threads_Destroy_Mutex( geoid_96_mutex );
00711 
00712     char message[256] = "";
00713     strcpy( message, ErrorMessages::geoidFileParseError );
00714     strcat( message, ": egm96.grd\n" );
00715     throw CoordinateConversionException( message );
00716   }
00717 
00718   fclose( geoid_height_file );
00719   geoid_height_file = 0;
00720 
00721   if( !mutex_error )
00722     mutex_error = Threads_Unlock_Mutex( geoid_96_mutex );
00723   if( !mutex_error )
00724     Threads_Destroy_Mutex( geoid_96_mutex );
00725 
00726   delete [] file_name;
00727   file_name = 0;
00728 }
00729

00731 void GeoidLibrary::initializeEGM84Geoid()
00732 {
00733 /*
00734  * The function initializeEGM84Geoid reads geoid separation data from a file in
00735  * the current directory and builds the geoid separation table from it.
00736  * If the separation file can not be found or accessed, an error code of
00737  * GEOID_FILE_OPEN_ERROR is returned, If the separation file is incomplete
00738  * or improperly formatted, an error code of GEOID_INITIALIZE_ERROR is returned,
00739  * otherwise GEOID_NO_ERROR is returned.
00740  */
00741 
00742   int items_read = 0;
00743   char* file_name = 0;
00744   char* path_name = getenv( "MSPCCS_DATA" );
00745   long elevations_read = 0;
00746   long num = 0;
00747   FILE*  geoid_height_file;
00748 
00749   Thread_Mutex geoid_84_mutex;
00750   long mutex_error = Threads_Create_Mutex( &geoid_84_mutex );
00751   if( !mutex_error )
00752     mutex_error = Threads_Lock_Mutex( geoid_84_mutex );
00753 
00754 /*  Check the environment for a user provided path, else current directory;   */
00755 /*  Build a File Name, including specified or default path:                   */
00756 
00757   if (path_name != NULL)
00758   {
00759     file_name = new char[ strlen( path_name ) + 11 ];
00760     strcpy( file_name, path_name );
00761     strcat( file_name, "/" );
00762   }
00763   else
00764   {
00765     file_name =new char[ 18 ];
00766     strcpy( file_name, "../../data/" );
00767   }
00768   strcat( file_name, "egm84.grd" );
00769 
00770 /*  Open the File READONLY, or Return Error Condition:                        */
00771 
00772   if( ( geoid_height_file = fopen( file_name, "rb" ) ) == NULL )
00773   {
00774     delete [] file_name;
00775     file_name = 0;
00776 
00777     if( !mutex_error )
00778       mutex_error = Threads_Unlock_Mutex( geoid_84_mutex );
00779     if( !mutex_error )
00780       Threads_Destroy_Mutex( geoid_84_mutex );
00781 
00782     char message[256] = "";
00783     strcpy( message, ErrorMessages::geoidFileOpenError );
00784     strcat( message, ": egm84.grd\n" );
00785     throw CoordinateConversionException( message );
00786   }
00787 
00788 
00789 /*  Extract elements from the file:                                           */
00790 
00791   num = 0;
00792   while( num < EGM84_ELEVATIONS )
00793   {
00794     if ( feof( geoid_height_file ) ) break;
00795     if ( ferror( geoid_height_file ) ) break;
00796     egm84GeoidList.push_back( readFloat( &items_read, geoid_height_file ) );
00797 
00798     elevations_read += items_read;
00799     num++;
00800   }
00801 
00802 
00803 /*  Determine if all elevations of file read properly, or NOT:                */
00804 
00805   if( ( elevations_read ) != EGM84_ELEVATIONS )
00806   {
00807     fclose( geoid_height_file );
00808     delete [] file_name;
00809     file_name = 0;
00810 
00811     if( !mutex_error )
00812       mutex_error = Threads_Unlock_Mutex( geoid_84_mutex );
00813     if( !mutex_error )
00814       Threads_Destroy_Mutex( geoid_84_mutex );
00815 
00816     char message[256] = "";
00817     strcpy( message, ErrorMessages::geoidFileParseError );
00818     strcat( message, ": egm84.grd\n" );
00819     throw CoordinateConversionException( message );
00820   }
00821 
00822   fclose( geoid_height_file );
00823 
00824   if( !mutex_error )
00825     mutex_error = Threads_Unlock_Mutex( geoid_84_mutex );
00826   if( !mutex_error )
00827     Threads_Destroy_Mutex( geoid_84_mutex );
00828 
00829   delete [] file_name;
00830   file_name = 0;
00831 }

00833 
00834 void GeoidLibrary::bilinearInterpolate( double longitude, double latitude, double scale_factor, int num_cols, int num_rows,
00835                           std::vector<float>& height_buffer, double *delta_height )
00836 {
00837 /*
00838  * The private function bilinearInterpolate returns the height of the
00839  * WGS84 geoid above or below the WGS84 ellipsoid, at the
00840  * specified geodetic coordinates, using a grid of height adjustments
00841  * and the bilinear interpolation method.
00842  *
00843  *    longitude           : Geodetic longitude in radians          (input)
00844  *    latitude            : Geodetic latitude in radians           (input)
00845  *    scale_factor        : Grid scale factor                      (input)
00846  *    num_cols            : Number of columns in grid              (input)
00847  *    num_rows            : Number of rows in grid                 (input)
00848  *    height_buffer       : Grid of height adjustments             (input)
00849  *    delta_height        : Height Adjustment, in meters.          (output)
00850  *
00851  */
00852 
00853    int index;
00854   int post_x, post_y;
00855   double offset_x, offset_y;
00856   double delta_x, delta_y;
00857   double _1_minus_delta_x, _1_minus_delta_y;
00858   double latitude_dd, longitude_dd;
00859   double height_se, height_sw, height_ne, height_nw;
00860   double w_sw, w_se, w_ne, w_nw;
00861   double south_lat, west_lon;
00862   int end_index = 0;
00863   int max_index = num_rows * num_cols - 1;
00864   char errorStatus[50] = "";
00865 
00866   if( ( latitude < -PI_OVER_2 ) || ( latitude > PI_OVER_2 ) )
00867   { /* Latitude out of range */
00868     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::latitude );
00869   }
00870   if( ( longitude < -PI ) || ( longitude > TWO_PI ) )
00871   { /* Longitude out of range */
00872     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::longitude );
00873   }
00874 
00875   if( strlen( errorStatus ) > 0)
00876     throw CoordinateConversionException( errorStatus );
00877 
00878   latitude_dd  = latitude  * _180_OVER_PI;
00879   longitude_dd = longitude * _180_OVER_PI;
00880 
00881   /*  Compute X and Y Offsets into Geoid Height Array:                          */
00882 
00883   if( longitude_dd < 0.0 )
00884   {
00885     offset_x = ( longitude_dd + 360.0 ) / scale_factor;
00886   }
00887   else
00888   {
00889     offset_x = longitude_dd / scale_factor;
00890   }
00891   offset_y = ( 90 - latitude_dd ) / scale_factor;
00892 
00893   /*  Find Four Nearest Geoid Height Cells for specified latitude, longitude;   */
00894   /*  Assumes that (0,0) of Geoid Height Array is at Northwest corner:          */
00895 
00896   post_x = ( int )( offset_x );
00897   if( ( post_x + 1 ) == num_cols )
00898     post_x--;
00899   post_y = ( int )( offset_y + 1.0e-11 );
00900   if( ( post_y + 1 ) == num_rows )
00901    post_y--;
00902 
00903   // NW Height
00904   index = post_y * num_cols + post_x;
00905   if( index < 0 )
00906     height_nw = height_buffer[ 0 ];
00907   else if( index > max_index )
00908     height_nw = height_buffer[ max_index ];
00909   else
00910     height_nw = height_buffer[ index ];
00911   // NE Height
00912   end_index = index + 1;
00913   if( end_index > max_index )
00914     height_ne  = height_buffer[ max_index ];
00915   else
00916     height_ne  = height_buffer[ end_index ];
00917 
00918   // SW Height
00919   index = ( post_y + 1 ) * num_cols + post_x;  
00920   if( index < 0 )
00921     height_sw = height_buffer[ 0 ];
00922   else if( index > max_index )
00923     height_sw = height_buffer[ max_index ];
00924   else
00925     height_sw = height_buffer[ index ];
00926   // SE Height
00927   end_index = index + 1;
00928   if( end_index > max_index )
00929     height_se  = height_buffer[ max_index ];
00930   else
00931     height_se  = height_buffer[ end_index ];
00932 
00933   west_lon = post_x * scale_factor;
00934 
00935   // North latitude - scale_factor
00936   south_lat = ( 90 - ( post_y * scale_factor ) ) - scale_factor;
00937 
00938   /*  Perform Bi-Linear Interpolation to compute Height above Ellipsoid:        */
00939 
00940   if( longitude_dd < 0.0 )
00941     delta_x = ( longitude_dd + 360.0 - west_lon ) / scale_factor;
00942   else
00943     delta_x = ( longitude_dd - west_lon ) / scale_factor;
00944   delta_y = ( latitude_dd - south_lat ) / scale_factor;
00945 
00946   _1_minus_delta_x = 1 - delta_x;
00947   _1_minus_delta_y = 1 - delta_y;
00948 
00949   w_sw = _1_minus_delta_x * _1_minus_delta_y;
00950   w_se = delta_x * _1_minus_delta_y;
00951   w_ne = delta_x * delta_y;
00952   w_nw = _1_minus_delta_x * delta_y;
00953 
00954   *delta_height = height_sw * w_sw + height_se * w_se + height_ne * w_ne + height_nw * w_nw;
00955 }
00956 
00957 
00958 void GeoidLibrary::naturalSplineInterpolate( double longitude, double latitude, double scale_factor, int num_cols, int num_rows,
00959                                int max_index, std::vector<float>& height_buffer, double *delta_height )
00960 {
00961 /*
00962  * The private function naturalSplineInterpolate returns the height of the
00963  * WGS84 geoid above or below the WGS84 ellipsoid, at the
00964  * specified geodetic coordinates, using a grid of height adjustments
00965  * and the natural spline interpolation method.
00966  *
00967  *    longitude           : Geodetic longitude in radians          (input)
00968  *    latitude            : Geodetic latitude in radians           (input)
00969  *    scale_factor        : Grid scale factor                      (input)
00970  *    num_cols            : Number of columns in grid              (input)
00971  *    num_rows            : Number of rows in grid                 (input)
00972  *    height_buffer       : Grid of height adjustments             (input)
00973  *    DeltaHeight         : Height Adjustment, in meters.          (output)
00974  *
00975  */
00976 
00977   int index;
00978   int post_x, post_y;
00979   int temp_offset_x, temp_offset_y;
00980   double offset_x, offset_y;
00981   double delta_x, delta_y;
00982   double delta_x2, delta_y2;
00983   double _1_minus_delta_x, _1_minus_delta_y;
00984   double _1_minus_delta_x2, _1_minus_delta_y2;
00985   double  _3_minus_2_times_1_minus_delta_x, _3_minus_2_times_1_minus_delta_y;
00986   double _3_minus_2_times_delta_x, _3_minus_2_times_delta_y;
00987   double latitude_dd, longitude_dd;
00988   double height_se, height_sw, height_ne, height_nw;
00989   double w_sw, w_se, w_ne, w_nw;
00990   double south_lat, west_lon;
00991   int end_index = 0;
00992   double skip_factor = 1.0;
00993   char errorStatus[50] = "";
00994 
00995   if( ( latitude < -PI_OVER_2 ) || ( latitude > PI_OVER_2 ) )
00996   { /* latitude out of range */
00997     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::latitude );
00998   }
00999   if( ( longitude < -PI ) || ( longitude > TWO_PI ) )
01000   { /* longitude out of range */
01001     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::longitude );
01002   }
01003 
01004   if( strlen( errorStatus ) > 0)
01005     throw CoordinateConversionException( errorStatus );
01006 
01007   latitude_dd  = latitude  * _180_OVER_PI;
01008   longitude_dd = longitude * _180_OVER_PI;
01009 
01010   /*  Compute X and Y Offsets into Geoid Height Array:                          */
01011 
01012   if( longitude_dd < 0.0 )
01013   {
01014     offset_x = ( longitude_dd + 360.0 ) / scale_factor;
01015   }
01016   else
01017   {
01018     offset_x = longitude_dd / scale_factor;
01019   }
01020   offset_y = ( 90.0 - latitude_dd ) / scale_factor;
01021 
01022   /*  Find Four Nearest Geoid Height Cells for specified latitude, longitude;   */
01023   /*  Assumes that (0,0) of Geoid Height Array is at Northwest corner:          */
01024 
01025   post_x = ( int ) offset_x;
01026   if ( ( post_x + 1 ) == num_cols)
01027     post_x--;
01028   post_y = ( int )( offset_y + 1.0e-11 );
01029   if ( ( post_y + 1 ) == num_rows)
01030     post_y--;
01031 
01032   if( scale_factor == SCALE_FACTOR_30_MINUTES )
01033   {
01034     skip_factor = 2.0;
01035     num_rows = EGM96_ROWS;
01036     num_cols = EGM96_COLS;
01037   }
01038   else if( scale_factor == SCALE_FACTOR_1_DEGREE )
01039   {
01040     skip_factor = 4.0;
01041     num_rows = EGM96_ROWS;
01042     num_cols = EGM96_COLS;
01043   }
01044   else if( scale_factor == SCALE_FACTOR_2_DEGREES )
01045   {
01046     skip_factor = 8.0;
01047     num_rows = EGM96_ROWS;
01048     num_cols = EGM96_COLS;
01049   }
01050 
01051   temp_offset_x = ( int )( post_x * skip_factor );
01052   temp_offset_y = ( int )( post_y * skip_factor + 1.0e-11 );
01053   if ( ( temp_offset_x + 1 ) == num_cols )
01054     temp_offset_x--;
01055   if ( ( temp_offset_y + 1 ) == num_rows )
01056     temp_offset_y--;
01057 
01058   // NW Height
01059   index = ( int )( temp_offset_y * num_cols + temp_offset_x );
01060   if( index < 0 )
01061     height_nw = height_buffer[ 0 ];
01062   else if( index > max_index )
01063     height_nw = height_buffer[ max_index ];
01064   else
01065     height_nw = height_buffer[ index ];
01066   // NE Height
01067   end_index = index + (int)skip_factor;
01068   if( end_index < 0 )
01069     height_ne = height_buffer[ 0 ];
01070   else if( end_index > max_index )
01071     height_ne = height_buffer[ max_index ];
01072   else
01073     height_ne = height_buffer[ end_index ];
01074 
01075   // SW Height
01076   index = ( int )( ( temp_offset_y + skip_factor ) * num_cols + temp_offset_x );
01077   if( index < 0 )
01078     height_sw = height_buffer[ 0 ];
01079   else if( index > max_index )
01080     height_sw = height_buffer[ max_index ];
01081   else
01082     height_sw = height_buffer[ index ];
01083   // SE Height
01084   end_index = index + (int)skip_factor;
01085   if( end_index < 0 )
01086     height_se = height_buffer[ 0 ];
01087   else if( end_index > max_index )
01088     height_se = height_buffer[ max_index ];
01089   else
01090     height_se = height_buffer[ end_index ];
01091 
01092   west_lon = post_x * scale_factor;
01093   
01094   // North latitude - scale_factor
01095   south_lat = ( 90 - ( post_y * scale_factor ) ) - scale_factor;   
01096 
01097   /*  Perform Non-Linear Interpolation to compute Height above Ellipsoid:        */
01098 
01099   if( longitude_dd < 0.0 )
01100     delta_x = ( longitude_dd + 360.0 - west_lon ) / scale_factor;
01101   else
01102     delta_x = ( longitude_dd - west_lon ) / scale_factor;
01103   delta_y = ( latitude_dd - south_lat ) / scale_factor;
01104 
01105   delta_x2 = delta_x * delta_x;
01106   delta_y2 = delta_y * delta_y;
01107 
01108   _1_minus_delta_x = 1 - delta_x;
01109   _1_minus_delta_y = 1 - delta_y;
01110 
01111   _1_minus_delta_x2 = _1_minus_delta_x * _1_minus_delta_x;
01112   _1_minus_delta_y2 = _1_minus_delta_y * _1_minus_delta_y;
01113 
01114   _3_minus_2_times_1_minus_delta_x = 3 - 2 * _1_minus_delta_x;
01115   _3_minus_2_times_1_minus_delta_y = 3 - 2 * _1_minus_delta_y;
01116 
01117   _3_minus_2_times_delta_x = 3 - 2 * delta_x;
01118   _3_minus_2_times_delta_y = 3 - 2 * delta_y;
01119 
01120   w_sw = _1_minus_delta_x2 * _1_minus_delta_y2 * ( _3_minus_2_times_1_minus_delta_x * _3_minus_2_times_1_minus_delta_y );
01121   w_se = delta_x2 * _1_minus_delta_y2 * ( _3_minus_2_times_delta_x * _3_minus_2_times_1_minus_delta_y );
01122   w_ne = delta_x2 * delta_y2 * ( _3_minus_2_times_delta_x * _3_minus_2_times_delta_y );
01123   w_nw = _1_minus_delta_x2 * delta_y2 * (  _3_minus_2_times_1_minus_delta_x * _3_minus_2_times_delta_y );
01124 
01125   *delta_height = height_sw * w_sw + height_se * w_se + height_ne * w_ne + height_nw * w_nw;
01126 }
01127 
01128 // CLASSIFICATION: UNCLASSIFIED
Generated on Wed Nov 25 10:53:09 2009 for MSP GEOTRANS by  1.6.1
